functions-question4_key2: This Example is in 2 parts. Submit the code of both the parts by writing them in the same file.
functions-question4_key4: Write a function named check_numbers which takes two numbers and then print "both are even" if both numbers are even (divide by 2) otherwise print "both numbers are not even".
functions-question4_key8: Now write a function named check_numbers_list Which takes the list of an integer as a argument and then checks whether both the integers with the same index are even or not.
functions-question4_key9: To check this, use the check_numbers function written in the previous Part 1.
functions-question4_key10: If you call your function [2, 6, 18, 10, 3, 75] and [6, 19, 24, 12, 3, 87] then it should give this output:
functions-question4_key12: If the integers on same index are even
functions-question4_key14: If the integers on same index are not even
functions-question4_key17:
both are even
both numbers are not even
both numbers are not even
both numbers are not even
both numbers are not even
